blacklistHelp: /blacklist - Add a user to the blacklist, so he will not receive rain. A user can be added to the blacklist if he is a member of the current group. But the restriction is global - it includes all groups. To remove a user from the blacklist use /unblacklist command. This command must be called from within the same group that it was originally issued in. The command can be called in the Reply message as well. Params: - userName / @string (or list of user names) - help (show this help) Examples: - /blacklist @user1 @user2 - /unblacklist @user2

help: â„¹ Help Airdrop and Tipping bot for Crypto Coins. The bot was initially introduced for Callisto Network. It now supports more coins and chains (CLO, ETH, ETC, BNB, LTC, BTC). Tokens (ERC20 and BEP2) are also supported (NOW, AWC, TWT). /start â€” Start a dialog with the Bot. Please register to use the Bot. Note: The bot takes a dev fee from lotteries and advertising (Twitter rain) functions. More promotional features to come. Support development of the bot by making a donation.
helpGroup: ğŸ¤– Crypto Bot ğŸ¤– Help â„¹ ğŸ“Œ Crypto Coins Airdrop and Tipping Bot ğŸ“Œ The bot was initially for Callisto Network. Supported coins and chains (CLO, ETH, ETC, BNB, LTC, BTC, USDT, NOW, AWC). The bot works with on-chain transactions, so standard transaction fees are applied to every operation. No other fees will be charged, except for lotteries. Support the bot maintenance and development with donations (you can simply tip the bot itself to make a donation). â¤ï¸ To start using the bot, first register with @${botNamae} - Use /tip to make a tip. - Use /give or /giveaway to start a giveaway. - Use /rain or /airdrop for an Airdrop. - Use /rtrain for an Airdrop based on retweets. - Use /stat to get stats. - Use /pot for lottery. - Type /help with command name to get additional info (use /tip help or /give help, either will work).
helpGroupAdmin:
ğŸ…°ï¸ Admins Only Commands ğŸ…°ï¸
- Use /locale for switching language.
- Use /defcoin for default coin in the current group.
- Use /deletereply to turn on/off messages auto-delete.
- Use /permitlottery for enabling or disabling lottery.
- Use /potnotify for disabling repeating pot notifications.
- Use /blacklist to block all rains for a specific user(s).
- Use /adminonly to limit the use of the bot to a select group of admins.
- Use /useQuotes to turn on/off quotes in the message footers.
- Use /whitelist to manage rain whitelists.
- Use /initbot to init bot for using in subscription and referral campaigns

potHelp: /pot - View info about current lottery, or take part in the lottery (buy a ticket). Lotteries are drawn every week on Friday at 07:00 PM (UTC). Minimal ticket price - 50x (or 20x for higher-priced coins) of the coin's minimal value (for example, 50 CLO coins). Every user can buy as many tickets as they want. Winners are randomly selected. The first winner gets 70% of the pot, second - 20%, last - 10%. If the number of tickets is less than 20, there will only be one winner, who will get the whole pot (minus the dev fee). Admins can disable lotteries in their group/chat - so no one can buy tickets or view pot status. The special case of buying tickets: You can buy tickets for another user(s) as a gift (either using the command in Reply to a message or using @UserName(s) with the command). In this case Pot Value may be omitted - default minValue will be used (1 ticket for each listed user). Dev fee: 10% of the pot. Params: - NO-params (view current pot by coin, default for current group). - code / string (coin code) - view pot status by selected coin. - value / number - your pot value (can not be less than the minimum ticket price). You can buy multiple tickets with one command by entering the value multiplied by the number of tickets you want. - userName / @string (or list of user names - to send ticket(s) as a gift to user(s)). - help (show this help). Examples: - /pot. - /pot ETH. - /pot 100 CLO - (buy 2 tickets in CLO lottery). - /pot @User1 @User2 - (buy 1 ticket in default coin lottery for each user listed, they must be registered with the bot).
potRules: ğŸ“ /pot help - for more info. ğŸ‘‡ use buttons to buy tickets ğŸ‘‡

rainHelp: /rain - Spread N coins among X random users. /airdrop command can be used instead of rain (same function). Params (space-separated, in any order): - value / number (if omitted - default value used). - coin code / string (if omitted - group default coin used). - NUMBER_of_Users / number (if omitted or ALL or MAX words used - VALUE divided by minimum possible value/per user - to get number of receivers). - WhiteListName / string (make rain for users from white list named WhiteListName )? - help (show this help). Note ğŸ‘‰ If 2 numbers are provided, and the min value for the coin is an integer - then the higher of the 2 numbers will be used as VALUE. If one of the 2 numbers is float - it will be used as VALUE. Users are counted inside the current group or channel. Examples: - /rain 20 10 CLO = (split 20 clo to 10 random users). - /rain 1000 = (split 1000 clo (if default is CLO) to 1000 random users, min value for CLO is 1, if only 100 - registered users found in chat - everyone gets 10 clo). - /rain = (split 10 (default) clo (default) to 10 (10 div 1) users.
rainTwListHeader: ${userName} calls Rain for retweets of ${link} with ${rainValue} ${coinName} for ${count} user(s).
refAlreadyMember: You are already member of the ${title}.
refNewMember: Welcome to CryptoBot! Join the ${title} and get reward token(s). Obtain a link and invite friends to receive even more rewards.
referralMenu: Promote your group/channel and get coins with the referral system.
rtrainHelp: /rtrain - Spread N coins among those users who retweeted a tweet. If no number for retweet target is specified - the first call of rtrain will only start the retweets counter. In this case, a second call with the same tweet link will show the tweet stats. If the retweets target = 0 - rtrain will run immediately. If the retweets target was set in the previous command, and the new command has target = 0 - rtrain will run immediately, all other targets are ignored, and the retweets collection stops. If no targets were specified or all targets were reached - retweets collection stops. Note: - bot takes 10% fee for each performed twitter rain. Params (space separated): - value / number (required for second call or for auto-rain, first found in params number). - coin code / string (if omitted - group default coin used). - tweet_link / url (link to the tweet). - retweets / number(s) (target number of retweets to reach for next rain - up to 4 targets for 1 tweet). - help (show this help). Examples: - /rtrain https://twitter.com/CallistoSupport/status/1255634622240743426 = (start collecting retweets for tweet ID = 1255634622240743426). - /rtrain https://twitter.com/CallistoSupport/status/1255634622240743426 1000 clo = (if called after prev command - calls rain for already collected retweets, ends collection of retweets). - /rtrain {url} 1000 clo 0 = (run rain immediately, ends collection of retweets). - /rtrain 1000 clo {url} 100 200 = (start collecting retweets, run rain when 100 retweets reached, then run another rain when 200 retweets reached, each rain spreads 1000 clo).

statHelp: /stat - Show stats for the bot's operations (global or for one coin). Params: - NO-params (view global stat). - code / string (coin code) - to view stats for a select coin. - help (show this help). Examples: - /stat. - /stat ETC.
statMemo: use /stat CoinName to get the stat of a coin.
subscriptionMenu: âœ‹ Welcome to paid channels subscription service!
tipHelp: /tip - Tip user(s) with provided amount for coins. If called in Reply message - the author of the replied message will be tipped. Special case: you can give tips with Lottery tickets (see help for POT command details). Donation: tip the bot itself to make a donation to the author. /reward command can be used instead of tip (same function). Params (space separated, in any order): - value / number (if omitted - default value used) - coin code / string (if omitted - group default coin used) - userName / @string (or list of user names) - pot (use POT special word to make tip with a Lottery Ticket, instead of coins) - help (show this help) Examples: - /tip @user1 @user2 10 LTC - (send 10 LTC to @user1, and 10 LTC to @user2). - /tip @user1 5 - (send 5 CLO (by default) to @user1). - /tip @user1 100 clo pot - (buy 2 clo lottery tickets for @user1). - /tip CLO - (send 1 (by default) CLO in reply of a message to tip the author of that message). - /tip @Crypto_TheBot 100 CLO - (donate 100 clo to bot's author).

wlistBot: Sorry. Impossible to add BOT to the white list!
wlistHelp: /whitelist (or /white ) - View or create white list for rain. Each whitelist only belongs to one group / channel. Note: white list Names ARE case sensitive! ( Crypto != crypto ). Params (space separated, in any order): - (no-param) (view known white lists for current group). - Name / string (create white list / view list contents, if list exists). ------ /whiteadd - Add user(s) to white list. Params (space separated, in any order): - Name / string (white list name). - @UserName / string(s) (add User(s) to white list). ------ /whiteremove - Remove user(s) from white list. Params (space separated, in any order): - Name / string (white list name). - @UserName / string(s) (remove User(s) from white list). ------ /whitepurge - Delete full list and clear contents. Params (space-separated, in any order): - Name / string (white list name).
